intro: Mentzelia pinnatifida var. uniseriata, commonly known as the slenderleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its showy, often blue or purple flowers. The species is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
